verses.verse: Then Job <WH347> answered <WH6030> and said, <WH559>
I have heard <WH8085> many <WH7227> such things: <WH428> miserable <WH5999> comforters <WH5162> are ye all. <WH3605>
Shall vain <WH7307> words <WH1697> have an end? <WH7093> or <WH176> what <WH4100> emboldeneth <WH4834> thee that <WH3588> thou answerest? <WH6030>

I <WH595> also <WH1571> could speak <WH1696> as ye do: if <WH3863> your soul <WH5315> were <WH3426> in my soul's stead, <WH8478> <WH5315> I could heap up <WH2266> words <WH4405> against <WH5921> you, and shake <WH5128> mine <WH1119> head <WH7218> at <WH5921> you.
But I would strengthen <WH553> you with <WH1119> my mouth, <WH6310> and the moving <WH5205> of my lips <WH8193> should assuage <WH2820> your grief.
Though <WH518> I speak, <WH1696> my grief <WH3511> is not <WH3808> assuaged: <WH2820> and though I forbear, <WH2308> what <WH4100> <WH4480> am I eased? <WH1980>
But <WH389> now <WH6258> he hath made me weary: <WH3811> thou hast made desolate <WH8074> all <WH3605> my company. <WH5712>
And thou hast filled me with wrath, <WH7059> which is <WH1961> a witness <WH5707> against me: and my leanness <WH3585> rising up <WH6965> in me beareth witness <WH6030> to my face. <WH6440>
He teareth <WH2963> me in his wrath, <WH639> who hateth <WH7852> me: he gnasheth <WH2786> upon <WH5921> me with his teeth; <WH8127> mine enemy <WH6862> sharpeneth <WH3913> his eyes <WH5869> upon me.

They have gaped <WH6473> upon <WH5921> me with their mouth; <WH6310> they have smitten <WH5221> me upon the cheek <WH3895> reproachfully; <WH2781> they have gathered themselves <WH4390> together <WH3162> against <WH5921> me.
God <WH410> hath delivered <WH5462> me to <WH413> the ungodly, <WH5760> and turned me over <WH3399> into <WH5921> the hands <WH3027> of the wicked. <WH7563>

I was <WH1961> at ease, <WH7961> but he hath broken me asunder: <WH6565> he hath also taken <WH270> me by my neck, <WH6203> and shaken me to pieces, <WH6327> and set me up <WH6965> for his mark. <WH4307>

His archers <WH7228> compass me round about, <WH5437> <WH5921> he cleaveth <WH6398> my reins <WH3629> asunder, and doth not <WH3808> spare; <WH2550> he poureth out <WH8210> my gall <WH4845> upon the ground. <WH776>
He breaketh <WH6555> me with breach <WH6556> upon <WH5921> <WH6440> breach, <WH6556> he runneth <WH7323> upon <WH5921> me like a giant. <WH1368>
I have sewed <WH8609> sackcloth <WH8242> upon <WH5921> my skin, <WH1539> and defiled <WH5953> my horn <WH7161> in the dust. <WH6083>
My face <WH6440> is foul <WH2560> with <WH4480> weeping, <WH1065> and on <WH5921> my eyelids <WH6079> is the shadow of death; <WH6757>
Not <WH3808> for <WH5921> any injustice <WH2555> in mine hands: <WH3709> also my prayer <WH8605> is pure. <WH2134>
O earth, <WH776> cover <WH3680> not <WH408> thou my blood, <WH1818> and let my cry <WH2201> have <WH1961> no <WH408> place. <WH4725>
Also <WH1571> now, <WH6258> behold, <WH2009> my witness <WH5707> is in heaven, <WH8064> and my record <WH7717> is on high. <WH4791>
My friends <WH7453> scorn <WH3887> me: but mine eye <WH5869> poureth out <WH1811> tears unto <WH413> God. <WH433>
O that one might plead <WH3198> for a man <WH1397> with <WH5973> God, <WH433> as a man <WH1121> <WH120> pleadeth for his neighbor! <WH7453>
When <WH3588> a few <WH4557> years <WH8141> are come, <WH857> then I shall go <WH1980> the way <WH734> whence I shall not <WH3808> return. <WH7725>
